name: Hard Justice League of America (Volume 1) Quiz / Test | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Justice League of America debuted in 'The Brave and the Bold' (vol.1) #28 in 1960.  Which of the following heroes was NOT originally a member of the team?
questions.explanation:
Atom.

	The original adventure up of the Justice League of America featured Flash, Green Lantern, Martian Manhunter, Aquaman, and Wonder Woman.  Batman and Superman were revealed to be members of the team, but they were not participants in this first story.

questions.text: The Justice League of America was awarded their own self-titled series in 1960.  Who was the first NEW member they admitted?
questions.explanation:
Green Arrow.

	Green Arrow joined in 'Justice League of America' (vol.1) #4.   (The Atom joins in issue #14 and Hawkman joins in issue #31.)

questions.text: Who is the first superhero to be extended a membership invitation by the Justice League, but turns them down?
questions.explanation:
Metamorpho.

	Metamorpho is offered a spot on the team in 'Justice League of America' (vol.1) #42 in 1966.  He refuses full time membership, but agrees to be a "stand by" member instead.

questions.text: In 'Justice League of America' (vol.1) #21 (1963), the Justice League meets what other superhero team for the first time?
questions.explanation:
The Justice Society of America.

	In this classic adventure, the Justice League of America and the Justice Society of America meet and team up in a two-issue story.  Sales were so positive that the two groups would team up annually for another twenty years.

questions.text: The Justice League lost two of its founding members (Wonder Woman and Martian Manhunter) in 1969.  What female character did DC quickly replace Wonder Woman with in the JLA?
questions.explanation:
Black Canary.

	When Wonder Woman lost her powers in her own series, she was forced to resign the JLA.  Black Canary had been a regular guest star in the Justice League because of her previous membership in the Justice Society of America.  She departed Earth 2 to reside on Earth 1.

questions.text: For the series' 100th issue, a three-issue crossover with the Justice Society, and several other past allies, had the Justice League searching for the members of what long forgotten team of heroes?
questions.explanation:
The Seven Soldiers of Victory.

	The Nebula Man had sent the various Seven Soldier members (Vigilante, Star Spangled Kid, Stripesy, Crimson Avenger, Shining Knight, Earth II Green Arrow and Speedy) through various places and eras in the past.  The JLA and JSA and friends broke into smaller teams to rescue them all.

questions.text: When the Justice League first formed, they operated out of a cave in Happy Harbor, Rhode Island.  In 1970 they moved into a new headquarters.  Where was it located?
options: Inside the Hall of Justice in Washington DC
questions.explanation:
In Earth's satellite orbit.

	The Justice League's satellite HQ orbited the Earth at 22,300 above the Earth.  Members were able to teleport to and from the headquarters using teleport stations located across the Earth.

questions.text: What character was extended membership to the Justice League of America, was considered a member, participated and many adventures, but never actually accepted membership on the team?
questions.explanation:
Phantom Stranger.

	The mysterious Phantom Stranger assisted the team, and was voted in by the active members. He disappeared before accepting and various writers had different takes on whether he was a member, reserve member or honorary member.

questions.text: In 'Justice League of America' #146 (1977), the League finally opts to abandon its "no duplicate powers" and "only one new hero at a time" rules.  By doing so, who is granted membership?
questions.explanation:
Hawkgirl.

	After helping the League in several past missions, Hawkgirl is officially extended full membership, along with returning member, Red Tornado.

questions.text: In 1984, the Justice League undergoes a dramatic membership change and they relocate their headquarters to Detroit, Michigan.  Four new, younger members are given membership.  Which two of them would end up dead before the series ceased publication in 1987?
questions.explanation:
Steel and Vibe.

	This Detroit iteration of the Justice League of America was extremely unpopular with most readers.  The series was cancelled and was replaced by a new title called 'Justice League International' later the same year.
